description: If n = Product p(k)^e(k) then a(n) = Product (p(k)-1)^e(k), a(1) = 1.
comments: Completely multiplicative.a(n) = A000010(n) iff n is squarefree (see A005117). - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Nov 05 2004Dirichlet inverse of A097945. - R. J. Mathar, Aug 29 2011a(n) = abs(A125131(n)). - _Tom Edgar_, May 26 2014
links: T. D. Noe and Daniel Forgues, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..100000 (first 1000 terms from T. D. Noe)
formula: Multiplicative with a(p^e) = (p-1)^e. - _David W. Wilson_, Aug 01 2001.
mathematica: DirichletInverse[f_][1] = 1/f[1]; DirichletInverse[f_][n_] := DirichletInverse[f][n] = -1/f[1]*Sum[ f[n/d]*DirichletInverse[f][d], {d, Most[ Divisors[n]]}]; muphi[n_] := MoebiusMu[n]*EulerPhi[n]; Table[ DirichletInverse[ muphi][n], {n, 1, 81}] (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Dec 12 2011, after R. J. Mathar *)
prog: (PARI) a(n)=if(n<1,0,direuler(p=2,n,1/(1-p*X+X))[n]) /* from _Ralf Stephan_ */(Haskell)a003958 1 = 1a003958 n = product $ map (subtract 1) $ a027746_row n-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Apr 09 2012, Mar 02 2012
author: _Marc LeBrun_
extensions: Definition reedited (from formula) by _Daniel Forgues_, Nov 17 2009
